items.title: Why Brandon Perea’s ‘Nope’ Audition Made Jordan Peele Cry
items.description: The actor’s unexpected take on Angel, the Fry’s worker, so won over the director that he decided during their meeting to rewrite the script.
items.author: Kyle Buchanan

items.title: B.J. Novak Went to Texas Looking for ‘Vengeance’ and Found America
items.description: The first film from a former star of “The Office” is a dark comedy about life in a nation that’s not as divided as we might think.
items.author: Dave Itzkoff

items.title: The Japanese Author Behind ‘Bullet Train’ Is OK That the Film Isn’t So Japanese
items.description: Kotaro Isaka dreamed that his novel would get the big-screen treatment. Now it’s an action thriller starring Brad Pitt. Does the lack of major Asian stars matter?
items.author: Motoko Rich

items.title: ‘Vengeance’ Review: A Dish Best Served With Frito Pie
items.description: In this comedic culture-war thriller, B.J. Novak, who wrote and directed, plays an aspiring podcaster chasing a true-crime story in West Texas.
items.author: A.O. Scott

items.title: ‘Sharp Stick’ Review: The Babysitter’s Schlubs
items.description: Lena Dunham’s new movie follows a 26-year-old who methodically gains sexual experience after having an uncomfortable affair.
items.author: Amy Nicholson

items.title: ‘Resurrection’ Review: Mother of Fears
items.description: A successful single mother encounters a terrifying man from her past in this crazily enjoyable horror movie.
items.author: Jeannette Catsoulis

items.title: ‘DC League of Super-Pets’ Review: #ReleaseTheLassieCut
items.description: Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart voice canine heroes in a family-friendly animated spinoff of the “Justice League” franchise.
items.author: Calum Marsh

items.title: Rediscovering Australia’s Generation of Defiant Female Directors
items.description: Gillian Armstrong, Jane Campion, Essie Coffey and others had waited years to tell their stories, as a Museum of the Moving Image series shows.
items.author: Devika Girish

items.title: Paul Sorvino: A Voluble Man Who Excelled as a Brick of a Mobster
items.description: The actor may be best known for “Goodfellas,” but he almost bailed on it because the character of the underboss Paulie Cicero was so difficult to pin down.
items.author: Glenn Kenny

items.title: ‘Hypochondriac’ Review: A Mother of All Breakdowns
items.description: A son tries to escape the fate of his mom in this psychological thriller.
items.author: Teo Bugbee

items.title: ‘How to Please a Woman’ Review: The Service Industry
items.description: A bespoke business that offers house cleaning and sex work for women is at the heart of this Australian comedy.
items.author: Natalia Winkelman

items.title: ‘A Love Song’ Review: When Moving Forward Means Looking Back
items.description: Two former childhood friends rekindle their connection in this sweetly hopeful story of romantic longing.
items.author: Jeannette Catsoulis

items.title: ‘Paradise Highway’ Review: A Test of Loyalty
items.description: A truck driver’s brother asks her to deliver a girl to sex traffickers in order to save his life in prison.
items.author: Concepción de León

items.title: ‘Ali & Ava’ Review: Don’t You Want to Sing Along?
items.description: Even as this romantic drama clings uncomfortably to the surface of an interracial relationship, the movie still delivers pops of color and memorable melodies, our critic writes.
items.author: Beandrea July

items.title: ‘Hansan: Rising Dragon’ Review: Naval Gazing
items.description: The dutiful Korean war movie “Hansan: Rising Dragon” recounts a spectacular 16th-century naval victory over Japanese invaders.
items.author: Nicolas Rapold

items.title: ‘A Balance’ Review: Critical Distance
items.description: Yujiro Harumoto’s slow-build morality tale puts an ambitious documentary maker in an uncomfortable position as her life begins to resemble her films.
items.author: Austin Considine

items.title: How to Find the One
items.description: After swooning at the interracial couple in “Bend It Like Beckham,” she knew how she wanted her romantic life to unfold. But the future had other plans.

items.title: Stream These Three Great Documentaries
items.description: A summer of soul, and plenty of soul-searching, in this month’s nonfiction film selections.
items.author: Ben Kenigsberg

items.title: ‘We Met in Virtual Reality’ Review: Home Sweet Home
items.description: This innovative documentary tags along with people who are finding happiness in a graphical online world.
items.author: Nicolas Rapold

items.title: Study Shows Disability Representation Onscreen Is Increasing, but Still Falls Short
items.description: The study published Tuesday also showed that television continues to lag behind film when it comes to representation of characters with disabilities.
items.author: Sarah Bahr

items.title: Paul Sorvino, Master of the Mild-Mannered Mobster, Dies at 83
items.description: A would-be singing star, he found success in Hollywood playing a variety of roles, but they were often quiet, dangerous men, like Paulie Cicero in “Goodfellas.”
items.author: Anita Gates

items.title: Marvel Unveils ‘Black Panther: Wakanda Forever’ Trailer
items.description: The studio announced news of the film’s release on Saturday at the pop-culture convention Comic-Con International in San Diego.
items.author: Livia Albeck-Ripka

items.title: Bob Rafelson, Director of ‘Five Easy Pieces,’ Dies at 89
items.description: A central figure in the New Hollywood movement, he was also the co-creator of the TV pop group the Monkees and featured it in a movie, “Head.”
items.author: Dennis Lim

items.title: Geling Yan Says a Movie Fails to Credit Her. The Film World Shrugs.
items.description: Geling Yan says that she is owed a screen credit for the Chinese film “One Second” — and that companies bringing it to Western audiences are complicit in censoring her.
items.author: Mike Ives

items.title: The Gag Is: Keke Palmer Is a Movie Star
items.description: With a face that launched a thousand GIFs, the actress is bringing her expressive range to “Nope,” Jordan Peele’s latest social thriller.
items.author: Niela Orr

items.title: Shonka Dukureh, Actress Who Sang ‘Hound Dog’ in ‘Elvis,’ Dies at 44
items.description: She made her Hollywood debut as Big Mama Thornton, giving a performance that one castmate called “a spiritual experience.”
items.author: Daniel Victor

items.title: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now
items.description: This month, horror takes a trip around the world, with demons creeping out Spain, Macedonia, the Netherlands and suburban America.
items.author: Erik Piepenburg

items.title: Jordan Peele’s New Film ‘Nope’ Explores ‘The Horse in Motion’
items.description: Is the rider in the 19th-century photographic experiments really unknown, as Jordan Peele’s film implies? It’s complicated.
items.author: Ben Kenigsberg

items.title: ‘Alone Together’ Review: Finding Love in a Pandemic Retreat
items.description: Katie Holmes writes, directs and stars in this minor-key rom-com set in 2020.
items.author: Teo Bugbee
